Choose your Totem Animal.
Totem Animal
Bear Totem
The spirit of the bear makes you tough enough to stand up to any punishment. While <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Raging</LSTag>, you have Resistance to all damage except Psychic damage.
Rage: Bear

Deals an additional [1] damage with strength melee weapons. Has Resistance to all damage except Psychic damage. Has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Strength <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. Cannot cast or concentrate on spells.
Eagle Totem

The spirit of the eagle makes you into a predator who can weave through the fray with ease. While <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Raging</LSTag>, you can use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Dash">Dash</LSTag> as a bonus action. Foes also have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag> against you.

Can use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Dash">Dash</LSTag> as a bonus action. Foes also have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag> against you.
Elk Totem
The spirit of the elk makes you extraordinarily swift. While <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Raging</LSTag>, your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> increases by [1].

Tiger Totem
The spirit of the tiger empowers your leaps. While <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Raging</LSTag>, your jump distance increases by [1].
Rage: Tiger

Wolf Totem

The spirit of the wolf makes you a leader of hunters. While <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Raging</LSTag>, your allies have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on melee <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against enemies within [1] of you.

Aspect of the Beast

The Aspect of the Tiger hones your survival instincts.

You gain proficiency in two skills from the following list: Athletics, Acrobatics, Stealth, and Survival.

The Aspect of the Eagle enhances your eyesight.

You gain Advantage on Perception Checks.

The Aspect of the Elk helps you roam far and fast.

You can use Aspect of the Elk, giving yourself and nearby allies extra movement speed.

The Aspect of the Wolf provides the hunting sensibilities of a wolf.

You gain Proficiency in Stealth, and can use Aspect of the Wolf.

Until the end of the barbarian's Rage, the ground within [1] of them is Difficult Terrain for your enemies, halving movement speed.
Bolstering Magic
The number of times you can use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_BolsteringMagic_Boost">Bolstering Magic</LSTag>. It is equal to your proficiency bonus.
Bolstering Magic: Spell Slot
Roll a d3. You or an ally regains one expended spell slot, the level of which equals the number rolled or lower.
Once a creature receives this benefit, that creature can't receive it again until after a long rest.
Can't recover a spell slot until after a long rest.

Exhaustion is measured in six levels: - Disadvantage on ability checks - Speed halved - Disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws - Hit point maximum halved - Speed reduced to 0 - Death

Totem Warrior

If you drop to 0 <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit point</LSTag> while <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Enraged</LSTag>, you can make a DC [1] Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead. Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a short or long rest, the DC resets to 10.
